nodes.bodyText: Yeah, even the latest Apache Commons Compress returns Date when calling TarArchiveEntry.getLastModifiedDate() or TarArchiveEntry.getModDate(). They are the only ways to get the file modification time.
Do we just have way too many instances of this?

Not too many, but the problem was that, strangely, I was not able to make @SuppressWarnings("InlineFormatString") work here. Adding the annotation right before the constant fields or before the class didn't work. Not sure why.
Another nuisance was that it forces to remove the constants on the *Step classes (like this one). The check complains only when the string is for a format string (e.g., containing %s), but for consistency, we'll have to remove non-format string constants as well.

but the problem was that, strangely, I was not able to make @SuppressWarnings("InlineFormatString") work here

I guess that was google/error-prone#1650
@PascalSchumacher ah, a bug in 2.4.0. Thanks for letting us know!
I'll hold off merging whit until they release a new version that fixes the @SuppressWarnings("InlineFormatString") issue.
